com.dsi.ant.plugins.utility.executor
Class AntChannelTask

java.lang.Object
  com.dsi.ant.plugins.utility.executor.AntChannelTask
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractSearchControllerTask, AntPluginDeviceIdleTask
public abstract class AntChannelTask
extends java.lang.Object

Defines a task to be used on an AntChannelExecutor

Field Detail

channel

public com.dsi.ant.channel.AntChannel channel
The ANT channel this task is running on.

Constructor Detail

AntChannelTask

public AntChannelTask()
Method Detail

disableMessageProcessing

public void disableMessageProcessing()
Disable sending messages to onReceiveMessage(MessageFromAntType, AntMessageParcel). Guarantees no messages will be sent after this method completes.

doWork

public abstract void doWork()
                     throws RemoteException
Executes the task. Tasks can access the ANT channel via the channel field. Note: By default message processing on onReceiveMessage(MessageFromAntType, AntMessageParcel)} is disabled until enableMessageProcessing() is called. During the execution you can use disableMessageProcessing() to synchronously disable processing.

Throws:
RemoteException - After the task deals with this exception internally (usually by canceling the task) it should forward the exception which will then fire the AntChannelExecutor.IDeathHandler.

enableMessageProcessing

public void enableMessageProcessing()
Enables forwarding all ANT messages from the channel to onReceiveMessage(MessageFromAntType, AntMessageParcel) when this task is active. Note: By default message processing is disabled until this method is called.

flushAndEnsureClosedChannel

public void flushAndEnsureClosedChannel()
                                 throws RemoteException,
                                        java.lang.InterruptedException
Ensures the channel is not open before this function returns regardless of current state. Discards any messages received by the channel until the close is complete. Note: Must not be called from the handleMessage() thread or it will deadlock.

Throws:
RemoteException - If the channel fails while attempting the close
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while flushing and waiting on the channel close event

flushAndEnsureUnassignedChannel

public void flushAndEnsureUnassignedChannel()
                                     throws RemoteException,
                                            java.lang.InterruptedException
Ensures the channel is in the unassigned state, unassigning and closing the channel as needed. * Note: Must not be called from the handleMessage() thread or it will deadlock.

Throws:
RemoteException - If the channel fails while attempting the unassign (or close if it was needed too)
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while flushing and waiting on the channel close event (if close was needed too)

getNextTaskToExecute

public AntChannelTask getNextTaskToExecute()
Returns the next task to execute. Used by the executor to get the next task. Set the next task using setNextTask(AntChannelTask).

Returns:
The next task to execute.

getTaskName

public abstract java.lang.String getTaskName()
Returns a name used to label the thread running this task and reported in error logging.

Returns:
Identifying name of this task.

getTaskRank

public int getTaskRank()
Returns an integer denoting the task rank relative to other tasks submitted to the executor. This is mainly useful in conjunction with handleInterruptRequest(int). By default returns 0.

Returns:
An integer denoting the task rank.

handleInterruptRequest

public boolean handleInterruptRequest(int interruptingTaskRank)
Decides how to handle a request to interrupt this task from another task. This method is called in a lock mutually exclusive to onReceiveMessage(MessageFromAntType, AntMessageParcel) so incoming messages will be 'paused' while this function makes a decision and an 'interrupted' flag at the beginning of onReceiveMessage(MessageFromAntType, AntMessageParcel) would be guaranteed to be seen before any further message processing is done. Note: If you implement an interruptible task, after this method is called, doWork() must finish executing within one second to be useful, otherwise the interrupting task will abort anyway. Returns false by default.

Parameters:
interruptingTaskRank - The getTaskRank() of the task requesting to interrupt. MAX_VALUE indicates the executor itself is requesting an interrupt and the thread will be interrupted regardless of the return value.
Returns:
False if this task will not or can not interrupt its current operation. True if this task will begin canceling itself, also, if true is returned the executor will also call interrupt() on the thread executing doWork().

onReceiveMessage

public abstract void onReceiveMessage(com.dsi.ant.message.fromant.MessageFromAntType messageType,
                                      com.dsi.ant.message.ipc.AntMessageParcel messageParcel)
                               throws RemoteException
Handles any incoming Ant messages while this task is being executed and message processing is enabled. Note: By default message processing is disabled until enableMessageProcessing() is called.

Parameters:
messageType - The message type to handle.
messageParcel - The message data to handle.
Throws:
RemoteException - After the task deals with this exception internally (usually by canceling the task) it should forward the exception which will then fire the AntChannelExecutor.IDeathHandler.

setNextTask

public void setNextTask(AntChannelTask nextTask)
Set the next task to execute when this one is finished. Used to chain tasks.

Parameters:
nextTask - the next task to execute
